lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau piqbiRqw piqbiRiq mY swvDwn qwhI qy giHysur huie nwiekw khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Patibritaa Patibriti Mai Saavadhaana , Taahee Tay Grihaysur Hui Naaikaa Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a loyal and faithful wife is ever conscious of fulfilling her wifely obligations, and that makes her the prime person of the family.

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn Dn Dwm kwmnw pujwvY soBiq isMgwr cwir ishjw smwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Dhan Dhaam Kaamanaa Pujaavai , Sobhati Singaar Chaari Sihajaa Samaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Her husband fulfils all her needs of bedding, clothing, food, wealth, house and other property, and she in returns embellishes herself to enjoy oneness with her husband on the nuptial bed,

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur isKn kau rwKq giHsq mY sMpdw smUh suK lufy qy lfwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sikhan Kau Raakhat Grihasat Mai , Sanpadaa Samooh Soukh Luday Tay Ladaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the True Guru keeps His devoted and obedient Sikhs lovingly in their householders life. With the blessings of ambrosial name of the Lord, he reaches the spiritual peace in their family life.

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn Dn Dwm kwmnw pivqR Awn dyv syv Bwau duqIAw imtwveI ]481]
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Dhan Dhaam Kaamanaa Pavitra , Aan Dayv Sayv Bhaau Douteeaa Mitaavaee ?481?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the desire of the sacred name, the True Guru blesses His Sikhs with food, bedding, clothing, mansions and other worldly assets. He removes all their duality of serving and following other gods and goddesses.  (481)
